column4: also  i have another question,  i an getting this weird unhandled lockdown -3  error when i try to plug my ipod touch 2g in
my ipod touch 2g has 3.1.3 custom firmware
Did you download the firmware using itunes?
nope its a custom jailbroken firmware http://www.whited00r.com/
weird thing is, it works on my intel iMac  but not my powerpc eMac
And both Macs are running Ubuntu?
Please paste the complete line you get with: lspci | grep -i broadcom
With the information you already provided, your chipset isnt supported. This must be verified.
Please just provide the line I asked you for :)
it says 01:03.0 Network controller broadcom corporation bcm4309 802.11a/b/g (rev 03)
Now we need the 9 chars resulting from: lspci -vn | grep -i BCM | cut -f3 -d" "
You dont have to reinstall, you can just update.
